Text: The Hour of Doom is drawing near, the moon has split asunder;\n\t\t\twhich is a clear proof that the same thing can happen to the\n\t\t\tearth.
Yet when they see a sign, the unbelievers turn their backs and\n\t\t\tsay: "This is an ingenious magic."
They deny this and keep on following their own fancies.\n\t\t\tUltimately every matter shall be laid to rest.
There has already come to them the information of former nations\n\t\t\tcontaining enough deterrents
and profound wisdom to serve as a warning, but warnings are of no\n\t\t\tuse to these people.
Therefore, O Prophet, let them be. On the Day when the caller\n\t\t\twill call them to a terrible event.
They shall come out from their graves, like swarming locusts,\n\t\t\twith downcast eyes,
rushing towards the caller and the same unbelievers will cry:\n\t\t\t"This is indeed an awful Day!"
Long before them, the people of Nuh (Noah) disbelieved. They\n\t\t\trejected Our servant, called him a madman and drove him out.
After admonishing the people for 950 years, finally he cried out:\n\t\t\t"Help me, O Rabb, I have been overcomed!"
So We opened the gates of heaven with pouring rain
and caused the earth to burst with gushing springs, and the\n\t\t\twaters met to fulfill the decreed end.
We carried him in an Ark built with planks and nails,
which drifted on under Our care: a reward for him (Noah) who was\n\t\t\tdenied by the unbelievers.
We have left that Ark as a sign, so is there any who would take\n\t\t\tadmonition?
How terrible was My scourge and how clear My warning!
We have indeed made the Qur'an very easy to understand the\n\t\t\tadmonition: but is there any who would take admonition?
Likewise the people of 'Ad did not believe then how terrible was\n\t\t\tMy scourge and how clear My Warning!
We let loose on them a tornado, on the day of their bitter\n\t\t\tmisfortune,
which snatched them off like trunks of uprooted palm-trees.
How terrible was My scourge and how clear My warning!
We have indeed made the Qur'an very easy to understand the\n\t\t\tadmonition, so is there any who would take admonition?
The people of Thamud disbelieved Our warning,
saying: "Are we to follow a human who stands alone among us? That\n\t\t\twould surely be an error and madness.
Was he the only person among us to receive this warning? Nay! He\n\t\t\tis indeed an insolent liar."
To Our Rasool Saleh, We said: "Tomorrow they shall find out who\n\t\t\tis an insolent liar.
We are going to send the she-camel as a trial for them.\n\t\t\tTherefore, watch them and have patience.
Tell them that the water must be shared between them and the\n\t\t\tshe-camel, and each will come to the water at its own turn.
At last the people of Thamud called out to one of their\n\t\t\tcompanions, who took the responsibility and hamstrung her.
Then how terrible was My scourge and how clear My warning!
We let loose on them one mighty blast and they became like the\n\t\t\ttrampled twigs used by a fence builder.
We have indeed made the Qur'an very easy to understand the\n\t\t\tadmonition, so is there any who would take admonition?
Another example is the people of Lut (Lot) who disbelieved Our\n\t\t\twarning.
We let loose on them a stone-charged tornado which spared none\n\t\t\texcept Lut's household, whom We saved by early dawn
through Our grace. Thus do We reward those who give thanks.
Lut did warn them of Our scourge but they doubted his warnings.
They even sought to snatch away his guests from him but We\n\t\t\tblinded their eyes, and said: "Now taste My punishment and the\n\t\t\tresult of disbelieving My warning."
At daybreak they were overtaken by a lasting punishment
as if to say: "Now taste My punishment and the result of\n\t\t\tdisbelieving My warning."
We have indeed made the Qur'an very easy to understand the\n\t\t\tadmonition, so is there any who would take admonition?
My warnings also came to the people of Fir'on (Pharaoh).
They disbelieved all Our signs. Consequently, We seized them the\n\t\t\tway a mighty powerful competent would seize.
O Qureysh, are your unbelievers better than they were, or have\n\t\t\tyou been granted an immunity in the Sacred Books?
Or, do they say: "Acting together, we can defend ourselves?"
Soon will their multitude be routed and put to flight.
Nay! The Hour of Judgment is the time promised to deal with them.\n\t\t\tThat hour will be the most grievous and bitter.
Yet, surely the wicked people persist in error and madness.
On that Day when they will be dragged into the fire with their\n\t\t\tfaces downwards, We shall say: "Feel the touch of hell!"
Surely We have created everything in perfect estimation (destiny\n\t\t\tand purpose).
We command but once and Our will is done in the twinkling of an\n\t\t\teye.
O disbelievers, We have already destroyed many like you. Will you\n\t\t\tnot take admonition?
All that they do is being added to their record books:
every action, small and big is being noted down.
Surely the righteous will be in the midst of gardens and rivers,
a place of true honor, in the presence of Almighty Sovereign.
